I have seen Gasland and read the transcript. I do not favor drilling near water supplies.  I favor 100% disclosure of fracking chemicals.
NY Times right now has terrific, balanced, non-ideological article about Cuomo and  fracking. Pros and cons. Well done. Just as it should be
Nat gas is like democracy, the worst form of  fossil fuel, except for all of the others. That's all i am saying here....
And remember , it is a risk -reward game. I wish coal were cleaner and nukes less dangerous and solar could power cars..
The fact that Cuomo has done the work on nat gas and concluded the rewards outweigh the risks is very heartening.
Anyway, i find the series off-based.  I do fear it will be used by pro-coal forces. I call em the black -lung-no rainbow coalition...HA!
How can  Times be right about made up reserves if we are in a glut and we have no place to even store it. We flare it off because of that !
Remember, i think that many nat gas stocks aren't that good because there is such an abundance of it. Times says that's untrue.
I am simply saying the more i dig the more i want to write an article about the articles!!
Fed reserve adviser quoted by Times, Deborah Rogers, is listed as a goat cheese farmer in the bio the Dallas Fed put out. Not an authority
$CHK internal doubter quoted in NY Times was a year out of school. I wish i had known that when i read about this "smoking gun."
The industry expert, Berman, the Times relies on said Haynesville would fizzle. It ended up being pretty fabulous. Not mentioned!
Electric cars plug into a coal-based system. I just want to be a skeptic of the skeptics.
I am pro domestic fuel sources. I think nuke post-Japan will be no go. I wish coal were cleaner. What does that leave for vehicles?
Natural gas--no panacea. Should be drilled carefully. But it is abundant and dirt cheap and cleaner. All disputed by the Times. ALL OF IT!
Plus, i don't read a lot of articles about the hazards of  coal mining  or the dangers of diesel.
As a close reader of the topic i actually don't see many mainstream press articles giving the positives.
I understand that Ian Urbina from the NYTimes has more negatives about nat gas coming.  I get that. But, he presumes the positives

Early returns--speech is a hit.. for stocks.. Maybe not with core Obama base.. but with the S&P which is where i come in/out
A year ago, i would have dreaded this speech if i were long stocks. Now i am thinking, hmmm, lots to buy!
I admit my own limitations. I am about stocks. I am not about politics, or clothes, or sports, or science..  Fine with me
I do not speak politically, i speak about what the speech will mean for stocks. I have been true north on this issue since the election...
To those who say "there is much more to this country than the stock market,"  I say, of course, but followers want to know my stock take!
Okay, can't have it 100% pro shareholders.. But i saying this is a substantive pro-biz speech.. Thrilled with it.
Taking on the plaintiffs' bar now! Where did this guy come from!
Now he mentioned the stock market practically in the first paragaph!
I urge followers to remember that a year ago, two years ago, it would have been ridiculous to think Obama cared about the stock market
If he were a GOP President the Dems would be going ballistic about all of this pro-biz stuff.
Obama admits health care law needs changing.. WOW!
Oil goes down if futures go down---not this tax break stuff.  Everyone always talks about getting rid of those breaks..
You can fight the guy, but he is not standing in the way of Dow 12,000 or 13,000 for that matter!!!!
So my early take is that this is a totally different president from a year or two years ago. Clinton pro-stock market Democrat
$FLR, $BAC, $CAT, $PNC, $DE, $GM, $F --all good---
BUSINESS!
Innovation, busines,s, tech, education, competitiveness-, infrastructure--this is THE agenda!
This is a speech about jobs, competition, innovation, business, tech-unthinkable a year ago...
I reiterate that THIS president is so different from the Pelosi-influenced one. You know i am on board
How much do you want to say "hey, what the heck is Al Franken doing there? "  But he good senator!
